text: All the Vermeers in New York is an American movie released in 1990. It was directed by Jon Jost. ==Plot== Mark is a broker on Wall Street who notices a woman that resembles a painting by Dutch painter Johannes Vermeer. The woman is named Anna and she is an actress from France. The two start a romantic relationship when they meet each other for the first time. Mark suffers from a cerebral hemorrhage while calling Anna and then Anna disappears into a Vermeer painting at the end. ==Reception== The film won the Caligari Film Award at the Berlin International Film Festival in 1991. Roger Ebert liked the film, but he thought that it ended too soon. ==References== Category:1990 movies Category:American drama movies Category:English-language movies Category:Johannes Vermeer Category:American independent movies
title: All the Vermeers in New York
